intro: Thapsia villosa var. minor, commonly known as the lesser thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale green leaves covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
